title: If I use non-copyrighted music (e.g. bensound.com or YouTube audio library) in my YouTube videos and gives them credit in my description, can I still be eligible for monetization? - Quora

response.answer_text: If you would use non-copyrighted music in your youtube videos, then you would be eligible for monetizations. Non copyright music stand for music upon which nobody has any copyright. Hence, can be used by anyone. There are lot of non-copyrighted music created by indie musicians available on youtube, that can be used for creating Videos.
If you use non-copyrighted music with CC license to commercial use than you are eligible for monetization in YouTube.
